qas.question: What shares an essential relationship to groups?
What are the symmetry groups utilized as a part of the Standard Model particle physics?
What groups are are utilized toward comprehending symmetry wonders in chemistry?
What groups can express the physical symmetry hidden behind special relativity?

plausible_answers.text: symmetry features of a geometrical object

qas.question: Point groups are used in what form of physics?
Poincare groups are used to understand molecular what?
What do Lie groups express in terms of special relativity?

context: Groups share a fundamental kinship with the notion of <a0_0><b5_0>symmetry<b5_0/><a0_0/>. For example, a symmetry group encodes <b4_0>symmetry features of a geometrical object<b4_0/>: the group consists of the set of transformations that leave the object unchanged and the operation of combining two such transformations by performing one after the other. <a1_0>Lie groups<a1_0/> are the symmetry groups used in the Standard Model of <b6_0>particle<b6_0/> physics; <a2_0>Point groups<a2_0/> are used to help understand symmetry phenomena in molecular <b7_0>chemistry<b7_0/>; and <a3_0>Poincaré groups<a3_0/> can express the <b8_0>physical symmetry<b8_0/> underlying special relativity.
